column4: is there any way i can change my default torrent application on the newest ubuntu
right click on a torrent file and choose properties then go to the "open with" tab
hey Hammerjak ive done that, but for some reason, when i open the torrents with any other client, they will not download
hey Hammerjak ive done that, but for some reason, when i open the torrents with any other client, they will not download
so it opens in the correct application but then doesn't download?
exactly Hammerjak
im not sure if it has anything to do with it being a private torrent site or not
which application is it not working with?
ive tried a few...
ktorrent
and vuze
are there any applications that work?
cant find the executable file for bittorrent though
the files download with the default client.  But the client is listed on the site as one not to use, because it has problems reporting the downloads and uploads
so i dont get credit for my seeding
ah
well, if it works in one application but not another then it must not be configured correctly
maybe wrong ports
: ive tried randomizing the ports (a feature of ktorrent) but that didnt help.  Where would i look for the executable file for Bittorrent?
'which bittorrent' ?
from a terminal
mind if we talk through private messages?
sure, but i'm not sure how much i'll be able to help
